text: Sukhothai Thammathirat Open University
is the first open university in Thailand.
We have been working in the field
of open education management for 44 years.
We open educational opportunities for everyone,
both domestically and abroad,
which is part of the university's mission.
Our goal is to become a digital university.﻿
to make various technologies accessible to all,
including providing equal access to education.
We had to adjust our operations due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
This included following regulations for online examinations:
Firstly, students
taking the same class had to take their examination concurrently,
regardless of their location.
We built an online examination system
but it couldn’t handle the high user traffic throughout the entire examination period during its first trial.
Finally, we've found the best solution.
We decided to work with AWS to improve the online examination system.
We used Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) to store our data,
which has been migrated to the cloud.
Our infrastructure is now completely on the cloud.
Final examinations are handled in two parts.
The first involves managing the university's operations,
in which STOU handles it through AWS as their IaaS provider.
The second involves provisioning workloads for examinations.
In the most recent round of examinations, we had to support 80,000 students taking examinations at the same time
and set up 20,000 examinations to be taken concurrently.
The user satisfaction rate for those who took the examinations
or accessed the system was nearly 100%.
Which helped us deliver results
and achieved our goals that we had set for this project.
